a.title: Go to Clyde F. Brown Elementary School

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

div.div: Please visit the Millis Schools Updates website for the latest information and updates from Our Superintendent, Health Services, Food Services, and Digital Curriculum Resources.

div.style: color: rgb(80, 0, 80); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;

span.style: font-family: Tahoma, Verdana, Arial, Helvetica; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

div.style: caret-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto;

strong.span:
The Millis Public Schools' Food Services is dedicated to ensuring all students receive breakfast and lunch during the Covid 19 Shut down, including on Good Friday and Patriot's Day.
In order to ensure that ALL students’ nutritional needs continue to be satisfied during this closure, we are offering all families the opportunity to have continued access to school meals. A “grab and go” breakfast and lunch will be available for pick-up, Monday, Wednesday and Friday outside of the Millis Middle/High School main entrance from 7:30-10:30 a.m.

span.strong:
Any person 18 or younger can receive breakfast and lunch for TWO days on Mondays and Wednesdays and for THREE days on Fridays. These meals will include an entree, side of fruit and/or vegetable, and milk. Parents and guardians of any student will be able to pull-up to the Millis Middle/High School front entrance and pick up their meals without having to leave their vehicle. These nutritious meals are available to any resident 18 years of age or younger.
ANY QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS Please contact Shawn Fallon, Director of Dining Services, at 508-889-4014 or by email sfallon@millisschools.org

span.style: font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: This offer is for all Millis Public Schools students but if your personal situation has changed and you need further assistance, please see the link attached for SNAP benefits where families can apply online for support

span.style: font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: SNAP is a government program through the Department of Transitional Assistance and may be helpful for some qualifying families.

div.span: Please help us spread the word to your friends and neighbors!

div.div: Click "Read More" to see the 2019-2020 Millis Schools newsletter.
div.a: Read More about Millis Schools Newsletter 2019-2020

div.div: Thank you so much for your patience with adjusting to remote learning this week! We know you are juggling many new worries and responsibilities these days, and we know it hasn’t been easy for you. Our hearts go out to you, your children, your families, and everyone affected by COVID-19. We are grateful for all our dedicated staff in the Millis Public Schools!
div.a: Read More about Remote Learning Update

div.div: Let me begin by thanking you for your patience and support during these unusual times. While our schools are empty, we are continuing to work to identify opportunities and strategies to minimize the significant impact on learning that the COVID-19 pandemic will have on our students and families.

As you have probably heard, Governor Baker announced this evening that schools throughout the state will be closed through April 7. Superintendents will have a conference call tomorrow to clarify some things that are still unclear. We all have many questions about how this will play out and there are a lot of moving parts at this time. This is uncharted territory and we appreciate that it may cause anxiety and that you all have many questions! We will do our best to get answers as quickly as possible.
div.a: Read More about 3 Week Closure Through April 7th

div.div: We have made the decision to close all of the Millis Public Schools for the period March 16- 20, 2020. Schools will remain closed through Friday, March 20, 2020. It is important for families to understand that this is an initial determination, and as we monitor the outbreak next week, it is likely that this may lead to a longer closure. This closure applies to all schools, extra-curricular activities, athletics, clubs, and building use. Our custodial staff will be cleaning and disinfecting all schools.
I am reaching out today to discuss COVID-19 and what we are doing in Millis to prevent and prepare.
The Millis Public Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, age, gender identity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, disability or homelessness.
